intro: Campylospermum dependens var. humblotii, commonly known as the slender campylospermum, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and small, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or limestone soils. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
